Cognate with Old High German begurtjan (â€œto begirdâ€), Gothic ğŒ±ğŒ¹ğŒ²ğŒ°ğŒ¹ğ‚ğŒ³ğŒ°ğŒ½ (bigairdan, â€œto begirdâ€). More at be-, gird.

verbs.description: begird (third-person singular simple present begirds, present participle begirding, simple past and past participle begirt or begirded)

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic) To bind with a band or girdle; to gird.
examples: Let him come forth to raise his arm with hide-begirded hand.

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic) To encircle, surround, as with a gird; enclose; encompass.
examples: for the whole Regiment, and safer far
in mine owne single valour, then begirt
